neighbors.name: Evans Ruth E
neighbors.claims: Ruth E. Evans (Ruth Evans Hardy) was a lifelong resident of Hardy County and an active member of the Oak Dale Christian Church and Rig Civic Center [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/ruth-hardy). She passed away in November 2009 at age 79, and was survived by her husband (who passed in 2018) and a son residing in Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/ruth-hardy).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through her surviving son or estate administrator. Outreach should acknowledge the family’s long local roots in Rig and their history with the local church and civic center.

citations.claim: Ruth E. Evans (Ruth Evans Hardy) was a lifelong resident of Hardy County and an active member of the Oak Dale Christian Church and Rig Civic Center
citations.title: Obituary for Ruth Evans Hardy

citations.claim: She passed away in November 2009 at age 79, and was survived by her husband (who passed in 2018) and a son residing in Hardy County
citations.title: Obituary for Ruth Evans Hardy

neighbors.name: Fittipaldi Joseph E & Carol A Geraci
neighbors.claims: Joseph E. Fittipaldi resides in the Old Fields area of Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/audrey-fittipaldi). His late mother, Audrey Fittipaldi, was born in Hardy County but spent much of her life in New York City before returning to Moorefield in later years [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/audrey-fittipaldi).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Joseph Fittipaldi with a focus on preserving the quiet, rural character of Old Fields, acknowledging his family's return to the area from an urban environment.

citations.claim: Joseph E. Fittipaldi resides in the Old Fields area of Hardy County
citations.title: Obituary for Audrey Jane Fittipaldi

citations.claim: His late mother, Audrey Fittipaldi, was born in Hardy County but spent much of her life in New York City before returning to Moorefield in later years
citations.title: Obituary for Audrey Jane Fittipaldi

neighbors.name: Wolfe Ernest E & Deborah A Life & Lawrence E Wolfe
neighbors.claims: Ernest E. Wolfe and his wife Deborah A. Wolfe reside in the Old Fields area of Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). They are part of a multi-generational local family; Ernest’s mother, Rama Wolfe (1932–2019), lived her entire life in Hardy County [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). Ernest's aunt, Velda V. Wolfe, also resides in Old Fields, indicating a strong family presence in the immediate vicinity [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe).
neighbors.influence_justification: Established local family with extended ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through a respected local neighbor. Emphasize the project's alignment with preserving family land legacies, as the Wolfe family has deep multi-generational roots in Old Fields.

neighbors.name: Wolfe Velda V Life & Ernest E & Deborah A Life & Lawrence E Wolfe
neighbors.claims: Velda V. Wolfe is an elderly landowner residing in Old Fields and is the sister of the late Rama Wolfe [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). She has family ties to Ernest E. Wolfe, who resides nearby in Old Fields [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with care through family channels, specifically her nephew Ernest Wolfe. Communications should focus on respect for the family's long tenure on the land.

neighbors.name: Bosley Jack W & Susan J
neighbors.claims: Jack W. Bosley is a Reverend who has served in the local religious community, evidenced by his pastoral title in local condolences [Fraley Funeral Home](https://www.fraleyfuneralhome.com/obituaries/rama-wolfe). The Bosley family has a multi-generational presence in Hardy County, with records dating back to the 19th century [1940 U.S. Census (Hardy County)](https://ldsgenealogy.com/WV/1940-Census-Moorefield-WV.htm).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Rev. Bosley with high respect for his community role. A face-to-face introduction that emphasizes community values and preservation of the rural landscape is recommended.

citations.claim: Jack W. Bosley is a Reverend who has served in the local religious community, evidenced by his pastoral title in local condolences
citations.title: Guestbook for Rama Ida Wolfe (Entry by Rev. Jack W. Bosley)
